sen.j: 西大路家（にしおおじけ）は、羽林家の家格を持つ公家である。
sen.e: The Nishioji family was a court noble family with the court noble family rank of Urinke.
The Nishioji family was a court noble family with the rank of Urinke.
The Nishioji family was a court noble family with the rank of Urinke.

sen.j: 藤原北家藤原末茂流であり四条家の分家である。
sen.e: The family was the FUJIWARA no Sueshige line of the Northern House of the FUJIWARA clan, a branch family of Shijo family.
The family came under the FUJIWARA no Sueshige line of the Northern House of the FUJIWARA clan, a branch family of the Shijo family.
The family came under the FUJIWARA no Sueshige line of the Northern House of the FUJIWARA clan, a branch family of the Shijo family.
The hereditary academic skill was calligraphy.
The hereditary academic skill was calligraphy.
The hereditary academic skill was calligraphy.
The family crest was waterclover.
The family crest was waterclover.
The family crest was waterclover.
The hereditary stipend during the Edo period was 100 koku.
Their hereditary stipend during the Edo period was 100 koku.
Their hereditary stipend during the Edo period was 100 koku.

sen.j: 明治維新後、子爵を授爵した。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, the family was conferred upon the title of viscount.
After the Meiji Restoration, the family was conferred the title of viscount.
After the Meiji Restoration, the family was conferred the title of viscount.

sen.j: 古文書によると四条隆綱を祖とする場合と孫の四条隆政を祖とする場合とがあり明確には分かってはいない。
sen.e: The founder of the family is not identified: Some old documents describe that Takatsuna SHIJO is the founder, and the others describe that Takatsuna's grandson Takasama SHIJO is the founder.
The founder of the family was not identified: Some old documents describe that Takatsuna SHIJO was the founder, and others describe that Takatsuna's grandson Takasama SHIJO was the founder.
The founder of the family was not identified: Some old documents describe that Takatsuna SHIJO was the founder, and others describe that Takatsuna's grandson Takamasa SHIJO was the founder.

sen.j: 西大路隆仲の代から西大路の姓が明記されている。
sen.e: The family name 'Nishioji' began to appear in documents from the generation of Takanaka NISHIOJI.
The family name 'Nishioji' began to appear in documents from the generation of Takanaka NISHIOJI.
The family name 'Nishioji' began to appear in documents from the generation of Takanaka NISHIOJI.

sen.j: 隆仲以降公卿を代々輩出していたのであったが西大路隆範の代に中絶。
sen.e: Since the generation of Takanaka, the family produced quite a few high court nobles, but the family line was cut off at the time of Takanori NISHIOJI.
Since the generation of Takanaka, the family produced quite a few high court nobles, but the family line was cut off at the time of Takanori NISHIOJI.
Since the generation of Takanaka, the family produced quite a few high court nobles, but the family line was cut off at the time of Takanori NISHIOJI.

sen.j: その後広橋総光の子西大路隆郷が西大路家を再興し1708年に公卿に再び任命されてから幕末まで代々公卿に任命された。
sen.e: Later, Takasato NISHIOJI. (a son of Fusamitsu HIROHASHI) restored the Nishioji family and, in 1708, reappointed high court noble--Since then, the family held the rank of high court noble until the end of the Tokugawa shogunate.

Later, Takasato NISHIOJI (the son of Fusamitsu HIROHASHI) restored the Nishioji family and, in 1708, reappointed high court noble--Since then, the family held the rank of high court noble until the end of the Tokugawa shogunate.

Later, Takasato NISHIOJI (the son of Fusamitsu HIROHASHI) restored the Nishioji family and, in 1708, reappointed high court noble--Since then, the family held the rank of high court noble until the end of the Tokugawa shogunate.

sen.j: 江戸時代の西大路家の石高は100石であった。
sen.e: The family's hereditary stipend during the Edo period was 100 koku.
The family's hereditary stipend during the Edo period was 100 koku.
The family's hereditary stipend during the Edo period was 100 koku.

sen.j: 菩提寺は龍光院 (京都市北区)である。
sen.e: The family temple was the Ryokoin Temple (Kita Ward, Kyoto City).
The family temple was the Ryokoin Temple (Kita Ward, Kyoto City).
The family temple was the Ryoko-in Temple (Kita Ward, Kyoto City).
